text: A train races across the desert. MOVE IN on an ARMORED CA Suddenly, the roof blows open.
Money bags fly out. ONE-EYED BART (Mr. Potato Head) follo
Money, money, money! Ha! Ha! Ha! Bart stashes the loot. Suddenly, a lasso yanks his arm of
Hey! The lasso lifts him off his feet. He falls, dazed. A figure approaches -- WOODY. He pins Bart with his boot.
You got a date with justice, One-Eyed Bart!
Too bad, Sheriff -- I’m a married man. A WAR CRY. Woody looks up.
Ai! Ai-ai-ai-ai-ai-yah! A Ninja warrior, ONE-EYED BETTY (Mrs. Potato Head), flips down the train roof, wielding a sword and nun-chucks.
One-Eyed Betty! Woody handsprings away. He gets to the end of the Caboose Betty hits him with her purse. He teeters, then falls.
Whoa, whoa... Ahhh...! Bart and Betty laugh, peek over the edge...
TILT UP to find Woody, riding BULLSEYE, JESSIE at the rei
I believe you dropped something, Mister!
Jessie?!
You've reached the end of the line, Bart. Bart pulls out a remote detonator.

I always wanted to go out with a bang! Ahead, a huge trestle bridge spans a canyon. ZOOM to REVEAL -- The middle of the bridge is loaded with dynamit Bart laughs, hits the detonator. The bridge explodes. Woody, Jessie, and Bullseye gasp.
Oh no!
The orphans! WHIP PAN -- A train car of TROLLS lean out the windows. One-Eyed Bart cackles.
Hate to leave early, but our ride is here. HONK-HONK! A pink Corvette, driven by the three ALIENS, pulls up alongside the train.
It’s me or the kiddies, Sheriff! Take your pick! The Potato Heads leap off the train into the Corvette. They speed off. Woody looks at the out-of-control train.
Ride like the wind, Bullseye! Bullseye runs up next to the speeding locomotive.
Hold him steady... Woody stands, then leaps from Bullseye into the locomotiv

Woody, hurry! Woody turns a gear, pulls the brake. Train wheels lock. Sparks fly. Woody looks ahead. POV -- The train skids toward the severed rails. Bullseye and Jessie skid to a stop at the canyon edge. Too late. Woody and the train plummet over the edge. Bullseye and Jessie are horrified.
No...! From deep in the canyon, a FLASH and RUMBLE. Then, the entire train rises into the sky. Holding it from below is BUZZ LIGHTYEAR.
Glad I could catch the train! Woody leans out the front.
Now let’s catch some criminals!
To Infinity... And Beyond!

A large, hand-painted sign reads: Border Crossing One Mile Outlaws Welcome  WHIP PAN -- The Corvette speeds past. The Outlaws laugh gleefully. Bart kisses his loot. The Aliens see something in the sky, point...
Buzz flies out of the sun, firing his laser. The Corvette is sliced in half. The halves fall away. The Outlaws tumble into a heap. Woody and Jessie step up. Buzz lands nearby, laser poised
Reach for the sky!

You can’t touch me, Sheriff! I brought my attack dog with a built-in force field! Bart WHISTLES. From above, SLINKY springs down the canyon walls, coils crackling with energy. He circles the gang, bites his tail. An ENERGY BUBBLE forms around them.
Well, I brought my dinosaur, who eats force-field dogs!

Yo-Dee-Le-Hi-Hooo00000000! The Earth trembles. Cracks form. The ground bursts open. A giant REX emerges, BELLOWING. He leans toward Bart, lets out a fearsome ROAR. A shadow. Rex stops. An intense HUM. Everyone looks up. An enormous, pig-shaped spaceship hovers above them.
Evil Dr. Porkchop!!! We FLY UP to...
DR. PORKCHOP (Hamm) sits on the bridge, sporting a bowler

That’s Mr. Evil Dr. Porkchop to you! Bart, Betty, Slinky, and the Aliens are suddenly beamed u Hamm flips open a switch. A red button: DEATH BY MONKEYS. He pushes it. The ship’s belly swings open. A yellow barrel is dropped. The barrel falls. It explodes into a mushroom cloud of crazed red monkeys. Woody, Buzz and Jessie flee. The Monkeys come after them. Rex ROARS. The Monkeys swarm over him, taking him down. Woody, Buzz and Jessie are overtaken and pinned down. The spaceship’s snout rotates and opens. A giant laser cannon powers up with a deafening HUM. Bart LAUGHS and reaches for a button marked with a skull and crossbones.. Jessie turns away, eyes shut. Bart LAUGHS louder. Buzz turns away. Bart CACKLES -- finger on the trigger. Woody grimaces...
INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Andy imitates One-Eyed Bart’s LAUGH. On Woody and Buzz. Andy’s hands move Woody as he “talks”.
Buzz! Shoot your laser at my badge!
Woody, no! It’ll kill you!

Just do it! Andy presses Buzz’s laser, makes a ricochet sound -- PSH -- off Woody’s badge and traces a line into the air... ...Where Hamm, the Potato Heads and the Aliens perch on a winged cardboard box, crudely fashioned into a spaceship, that dangles from the ceiling. Andy hits the carton -- PPPKOOOOOSHHH!!! The Toys tumble to pillows on the floor.

MOM’S hand pushes open a door. Andy, 8, in his cowboy hat jumps around making EXPLOSION NOISES. He’s turned his room into a Western “set” complete with a Tinkertoy trestle bridge, a Barrel of Monkeys, etc.
(as Woody ) . You're going to jail, Bart. Camera ZOOMS IN. Andy looks up, stops.
No, no...! Keep playing! Just pretend I’m not here. Suddenly, MOLLY, 2, toddles in, knocking over Tinker Toys
Oh, no! Molly...!

No, it’s okay, Mom! It’s... A 50- foot baby from outer space! She’s on a rampage! Run for your lives! Andy races around. Chaos, laughing. Buster enters, BARKIN The CAMERA PIVOTS UPSIDE-DOWN, revealing Mom’s face.

Does the red light mean it’s going? The TAPE GLITCHES and we JUMP TO... BEGIN MUSIC -- “You’ve Got A Friend In Me”  INT. ANDY’S KITCHEN - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Molly sits in a high chair, party hat on, eating cake. Camera PANS Andy's Toys, wearing party hats. End on Andy, holding Woody, stuffing cake in his mouth.
Come on, say ‘Happy Birthday’ to Molly...
(mouth full) Happhy Brffday!
Oh, charming. Andy holds Woody up to CAMERA, cake crumbs flying.
Happhy Brffday!!!
INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Mom pencils a line above Andy’s head onto the door frame.
Look how tall you’re getting! Andy steps away and beams.

INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy holds Woody against the door frame, marks a line abo Woody’s head. ZOOM OUT to reveal lines and labels for all the toys, including for “Slinky” and “Slinky’s Butt”.
Andy gives Woody a piggyback ride.
INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy holds Buzz towards camera, shoots his laser.
“Buzz Lightyear to the rescue!”
Good work Buzz! Andy makes Buzz and Woody high five.

INT. ANDY’S ROOM - NIGHT - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy lies in a pillow fort, surrounded by toys, eating fr a huge bowl of popcorn, and watching an off-screen TV. He stuffs popcorn in Rex’s mouth, turns back to the TV. His eyes widen. The popcorn tumbles out of Rex’s mouth.
EXT. ANDY’S FRONT YARD - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy rockets Jessie and Bullseye around the front yard, while Mom struggles to keep him in the FRAME.

INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY - HANDHELD CAMCORDER POV Andy, laughing, spins around, falls on his bed, pulls his toys close -- holding Woody, Buzz and Jessie in the warm, glowing embrace of a child’s innocent and boundless love. The song FADES on “Our friendship will never die...”
Okay -- places, everyone! C’mon, get in position! INT. TOY CHEST, ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Dark, crowded. Toys crammed together. Light seeps in. Nervous, backstage jitters. They speak in HUSHED TONES.
Wait -- I can’t find my other eye!
Someone's foot is in my face...
It’s mine! Give it back!
You saved our lives! We are eternally grateful! Potato Head groans. Buzz sits by the rim. Jessie climbs u
Buzz, mind if I squeeze in next to ya?!
Yes! No! I mean...! Why would I mind?! Squeezing next to... You! He laughs, nervous. She grins. Finally, he turns away.
Is it hot in here?
Here they come! The Toys clamber to the rim and gaze out. POV -- SARGE and two ARMY MEN slip in the room, dragging something in a gym sock. The Army Men arrive at the chest. Woody peers down.
Sarge! You got it...?!
Mission accomplished! The Toys are thrilled. The Army Men hoist the sock up.
Careful...! Careful!!! Buzz turns the sock upside-down. A cell phone slides out. Toys gather around.
All right, guys. We got one shot at this. Everyone ready?
We're ready, Woody! Let’s do it!  10

Buzz -- make the call. Buzz flips open his wrist cover. A phone number is writte inside. Jessie pulls out a cordless phone, leans close to Buzz. Buzz chuckles, nervous. Jessie dials the phone. Woody tosses the cell phone to Rex. Jessie gets to the last digit, hits it. Silence. Suddenly, the cell phone RINGS. Rex yelps. Buzz, Jessie and Woody peer over the rim. FOOTSTEPS on th stairs.
Target is on approach. Woody’s eyes are fixed on the door.

Just like we rehearsed it, guys... The door opens. ANDY enters but we only SEE his jean-clad legs. He scans the room, zeroes in on the toy chest. He lifts the lid REVEALING... Andy is a teenager. His hair is long and his voice deep, but he has the same kind face. He looks down, puzzled. The Toys lie, lifeless, amid sports equipment and clothin The phone RINGS again. Andy’s hand rummages. Woody hugs the cordless as Andy's fingers pass by and fin the cell phone. He pulls it out. The phone is stuck in Rex’s arms. Andy pulls. Rex clings. Andy finally yanks the phone loose.
Hello...? CLOSE ON -- Woody, holding the phone. He closes his eyes.
Hello...?! Anyone there? Andy hangs up, turns.
Molly, stay outta my room!  11
I wasn’t in your room! Andy scoffs, looks down at Rex in his hand. Rex lies frozen, smiling -- eager to be played with. Andy drops Rex in the box, shuts the lid, heads out.
Then who was messing with my stuff?
It wasn’t me...! He departs, closing the door -- CLICK. CREAK -- Woody and Buzz push the chest open, share a look The other Toys climb out.
Well, that went well! They spill out onto the floor. The room has changed -- rock posters, guitar, skateboard, other teen detritus.
He held me! He actually held me!
Oh, this is just sad.
Who are we kiddin’? The kid’s seventeen years old! Woody and Buzz jump down, exchange a glance. Buzz nods. Woody waves his arms.
Guys, hey, hold up! We need a staff meeting! Everyone? A staff meeting! GROANS of boredom.
Not again...!
Oh, come on! Slink? Gather everyone up!
Uh... We are gathered, Woody! The Toy Community is a lot smaller. Woody rolls with it.  12
Okay. First off -- we all knew Operation Playtime was a long shot...
More like a misfire!
..-But we’ve always said this job isn’t about getting played with. It’s about...
.--Being there for Andy. We know.
But we can try again, right? Woody looks at all of them. He shakes his head.
I’m callin’ it, guys. We’re closin’ up shop. Gasps. Everyone is crushed by this news.
Andy's going to college any day now... That was our last shot. Mrs. Potato Head begins to sniffle. Buzz steps forward.
We're going into Attic Mode, folks. Keep your accessories with you at all times -- spare parts, batteries... Anything you need for an orderly transition. Potato Head steps up.
“Orderly?” Don’t you get it?! We’re done! Finished! Over the hill!

Hey, hey, now come on, guys! We all knew this day was coming! Buzz, in FOREGROUND, sees something off-screen, frowns. POV -- Sarge and the Army Men climb up onto Andy’s desk. The other Toys keep arguing.  13 HAMM (0.C. Yeah, but now its here!
Look, every toy goes through this! No one wants to see their kid leave!
Hey! Sarge! What are you doing?! Everyone turns. Sarge and his last two Soldiers climb to the window sill.
War’s over, folks. Me ‘n the boys are movin’ on.
Moving on...?!
You're going AWOL?!
We done our duty. Andy’s grown up.
And let’s face it -- when the trash bags come out, we Army guys are the first to go.
Trash bags...?!
Who said anything about trash bags?
It has been an honor serving with you. Good luck, folks. Sarge straps in tandem with Soldier One. They leap. Their parachute opens and the wind carries them off.
You're gonna need it...! He jumps and flies off too. The Toys are stunned.
No, no... Wait...! Wait! Wait!!!
We're getting thrown away?!
No! No one’s getting thrown away!
How do you know?! Jessie begins to panic.
We're being abandoned...!
We’ll be fine, Jessie!
So why did Sarge leave?!
Should we leave?!
I thought we were goin’ to the attic!
Oh, I hate all this uncertainty...! Woody turns, waves his arms.
Whoa, whoa! Hold on! Quiet!!! No one’s getting thrown out, okay?! We’re all still here, aren’t we?! (beat) I mean, yeah, we've lost friends along the way -- Wheezy and Etch and...
Bo Peep...? Woody nods, stoic.

Even... Even Bo. All good toys who've gone on to new owners. But through every yard sale, every spring cleaning, Andy held on to us. He must care about us or we wouldn’t be here. You wait -- Andy’s gonna tuck us in the attic. It’1ll be safe and warm..
..-And we'll all be together. 14  15
Exactly. There’s games up there, and books... And, and...
The race-car track...
The race-car track. Thank you!
And the old TV...!
There you go -- the old TV! And those guys from the Christmas decorations box! They’re fun, right? The Toys shrug, MURMUR in semi-agreement. Woody softens.
And someday -- if we're lucky -- Andy may have kids of his own...
And he’ll play with us then, right? Woody looks at Rex, unable to say “yes”.
We'll always be there for him.
Come on, guys! Let’s get our parts together, get ready, and go out on a high note. The Toys disperse.
I'd better find my other eye...
Where'd ya leave it this time? She puts a hand over her empty eye socket.
Someplace dark. And dusty! Hamm turns to Rex.
C’mon. Let’s see how much we're goin’ for on eBay...  16 Woody watches as the Toys trudge off.
Don’t worry. Andy’s gonna take care of us. I guarantee it.

Woody climbs up, surveys the room -- posters, guitar, textbooks. He turns to a cork board where Andy's high school graduation photo is pinned. He lifts it to find... A SNAPSHOT shows an eight-year-old Andy wearing a cowboy hat and posing with Woody and Buzz and all of Andy's toys Woody gazes at the halcyon past he can never return to. Buzz steps up behind him.
You guarantee it, huh...?
I dunno, Buzz. What else could I say?
Whatever happens, at least we’ll be together. CLOSE ON -- The SNAPSHOT of young Andy.
For Infinity and Beyond... FOOTSTEPS on the stairs. Woody and Buzz turn.
Can I have your stereo?
No!
Why not?
‘Cause I’m taking it with me! The Toys scramble back into the toy chest. Andy enters with Molly close behind.
Can I have your computer?  17
No!
Your video games?
Forget it, Molly! Molly sighs, walks off. Andy starts typing on his laptop. Andy’s Mom enters carrying cardboard boxes and trash bags

Okay, Andy, let’s get to work here. Anything you're not taking to college either goes in the attic, or it’s trash. She picks up a box and writes “College” in magic marker. Andy stares at his computer.
Mom, I’m not leaving ‘til Friday!
C’mon -- it’s garbage day.
Mom...! She picks up his skateboard, puts it in the “College” box

Look, it’s simple: Skateboard? College. Little league trophy? Probably attic. Apple core? Trash. You can do the rest. She tosses an apple core in a trash bag, hands it to Andy Molly opens the Toy Chest.
Why do you still have these Toys?
Molly, out of my room...!
Three more days and it’s mine...! She strides out the door.
Molly, you’re not off the hook either!  18
The Toys watch as Mom picks up a box, enters Molly's room
You have more toys than you know what to do with. Some of ‘em could make other kids really happy...
What kids...?
The children at the day care. They're always asking for donations. Rex whispers.
What’s “day care”?
Shhh...!!! Mom writes SUNNYSIDE on the box. Molly pouts.
But, Mom...

No “buts”. You choose the toys you wanna donate. I’11 drop ‘em off at Sunnyside. Mom leaves. Molly sighs -- Moms! -- surveys the room. She picks up a xylophone, a Magic 8-Ball, puts them in the bo She picks up her old Barbie. MOLLY POV -- Barbie smiles, desperately eager to please. Molly, indifferent, tosses Barbie into the box, then buri her face in a “Teen” magazine.
Across the hall, the Toys react.
Poor Barbie...!
I get the Corvette.  19 INT. ANDY’S ROOM - DAY Mom walks back and finds Andy still on his laptop.
Andy, come on -- you need to start making decisions.
Like what? She pulls open the toy chest.
Like, what are you gonna do with these toys? Should we donate ‘em to Sunnyside?
Maybe sell them online...?
Mom -- no one’s gonna want those old toys. They’re junk!
Silently hear this bombshell. Mom lowers the lid.
Fine. You have ‘til Friday -- anything that’s not packed for college, or in the attic, is getting thrown out.

“Whatever you say, Mom.” He stares at his laptop. She shakes her head, exits. Andy sighs, closes his laptop. He turns, surveys his room He rolls his chair to the toy chest and opens the lid. Inside are the Toys -- his old friends. They lie frozen, smiling, forever eager to play. Andy gazes at them, making a decision. Abruptly, he grabs a trash bag, snaps it open. He picks u the Toys -- Rex, Potato Head, Jessie -- tosses them in.  20 He pulls Hamm's cork, empties the change out, and dumps him, with rest of the Toys, in the trash bag. Then Andy picks up Buzz and Woody, looks at them. POV -- Buzz, grinning and heroic. Woody, smiling and loya TOYS POV -- Andy turns, tosses Woody in the College box. The Toys gasp. Andy drops Buzz into the garbage bag.
Buzz is stunned and hurt. Andy cinches the bag closed and carries it from the room. Behind him, Woody pops up from the College box, shocked.
It’s dim and crowded.
What’s happening...?!!!

We're getting thrown out, you idiot! That’s what’s happening!!! Woody jumps from the box, runs across the room, hides behind the door frame. Andy walks onto the hall landing, reaches up, and pulls open a trapdoor ladder that leads to the attic. Woody watches, relieved. Andy begins climbing to the attic. One rung... Two... Molly enters the hall landing, struggling with her box. It hits the door frame. A Magic 8-Ball falls out.
You need a hand?
I got it... Andy steps down, leaves the bag at the foot of the ladder grabs the 8-Ball. He helps Molly carry her box downstairs
Here. So, you gonna miss me when I’m gone?  21
If I say ‘no’, do I still get your room?
Nope.
Then, yes, I'll miss you. They disappear.
The Toys are piled all over each other. Jessie is hyper- ventilating. Buzz looks around -- plotting his next move.
I can’t breathe!
This can’t be happening!!!
Quiet...!!!! What’s that sound? They all listen. A faint CREAKING.
The attic ladder -- spring loaded -- retracts, pushing th toy-filled trash bag out of the way.
The bag is tipped over. The Toys tumble over each other.
Whooaaaaa...!!!

The ladder pushes free and rises to the ceiling, retracti completely. Woody tiptoes into the hall toward the bag. Suddenly, Mom enters carrying a trash bag. Woody retreats Mom trips over the toy-filled bag, looks down -- irritate
Andy...?! No answer. Mom sighs, picks up the toy-filled bag and exits, carrying it downstairs.  22 ANDY’S ROOM Woody -- at the door -- is electrified.
That’s not trash! That’s not trash!! He steps back, mind reeling.
Think, Woody...! Think! Think! (an idea) Oooh! (whistles) Buster! C’mere, boy! C’mere! Off-screen PAWS and the JINGLE of a dog collar. Buster enters -- old, saggy, panting. Woody vaults onto his back
Okay, boy! To the curb! Hyah!!! Buster yawns and flops over, pinning Woody under him.

No, Buster, no...! Woody grabs Buster by the jowls, pulls him backwards. Finally, Buster rolls over. Woody sits up, gasping. Off-screen, a door SLAMS. Woody turns. Woody rushes to the window, gazes out. POV -- Mom drops the trash bags at the curb. WHIP PAN -- Rumbling up the street is a garbage truck. Woody gasps.
Mounting panic.
We’re on the curb!
Oh, I knew it would come to this! Buzz grabs the side of the bag, tries to tear it open.

Pull, everyone! Pull!!!  23 EXT. ANDY’S HOUSE - DAY Woody grabs a pair of scissors, shoves them in his holste He lunges for the drainpipe, slides down, hits a gutter a tumbles into the bushes below. CRASH!
The Toys follow Buzz’s lead, pulling the sides of the bag
It won't rip!
Ah, forget it! It’s triple-ply high- density polyethylene!
There’s gotta be a way out!
Andy doesn’t want us! What’s the point?
(thinking) Point... Point... POINT!!! Buzz looks at Rex’s pointy tail.
The truck RUMBLES closer, two driveways away.
The Toys follow Buzz, shoving Rex backwards.
Push! Push!!!
I can hear the garbage truck!
The bag stretches. Rex’s tail is nearly through.
It’s getting closer-fffmmm! Rex is muffled by a mouthful of plastic.  24

Woody uses the scissors to snip his way out of the bush. The garbage truck approaches Andy’s driveway. Woody races out, dives behind the mail box post. The GARBAGE MAN is in head phones, playing air guitar, drummi the mail box. He empties a garbage can into the truck. Woody ducks from behind the post, plunges his scissors in a garbage bag. Garbage spills out: wrong bag. He tries another. No luck. As the Garbage Man turns, Woody ducks behind the post. Th Garbage Man grabs the last bags, tosses them in the truck He climbs on a running board, SLAPS the side. The truck shifts into gear and lurches off down the stree

As the truck rumbles off, Woody ducks from behind the mai box, runs after it. The truck pulls up at the next house. Woody hides behind a fire hydrant. The Garbage Man hops off the runner, yanks a lever. The truck’s compactor lowers, scoops up the trash bags. From behind the hydrant, Woody watches in horror. The compactor retracts, CRUNCHING the bags remorselessly.
Buzz...!!! Jessie...!!! A TINKLE. Woody turns. In Andy’s driveway, an upside-down recycling bin scurries on little feet into the garage. Woody sighs, relieved.
The Toys cast off the bin. They are traumatized.
Andy threw us out...!
Like we were garbage...!
“Junk”! He called us “junk”!  25
How could he...?! She SOBS on Mr. Potato Head’s shoulder.
(to himself) This doesn’t make any sense...! Jessie is furious.
I should’'a seen this coming! It’s Emily all over again! She turns and scans the garage -- galvanized, determined.
Sarge was right...!
Yeah! And Woody was wrong!
Wait a minute! Hold on! This is no time to be hysterical.
It's the perfect time to be hysterical!
(hysterical) Should we be hysterical...?!!!
No!
Yes!
Maybe! But not right now!
Yeeeeeeeeeeeeeee--hawwwwwwwwww...!!! Everyone turns. Jessie is smiling.

Fellas -- I know what to do! They follow her gaze. In the hatchback of Mom’s car is Molly’s box of toys, marked SUNNYSIDE.  26 EXT. ANDY’S YARD - DAY Woody darts from a tree to a landscape boulder, sneaking towards the garage. He peeks out from behind a flowerpot.
What the heck...?! WOODY’S POV -- The Toys clamber into the Donation Box.
Buzz stands outside the Donation Box as the other Toys clamber in. Jessie helps the Aliens up into the box.
We should’a done this years ago!
Jessie, wait...! What about Woody?!
He's fine, Buzz! Andy’s takin’ him to college! Now we need to go! Buzz looks at her and the others.
You're right. Come on! He helps pass the Aliens up. Woody approaches, incredulou
Buzz...?
Woody...!
What’s going on? Don’t you know this box is being donated!
It’s under control! We have a plan!
We're going to Day Care!
Day Care?! What -- have you all lost your marbles?!
Didn't you see? Andy threw us away!  27
No...! No, no, no! He was putting you in the attic!
Attic? So how’d we end up on the curb?!
That was a mistake! Andy’s Mom thought you were trash!
Yeah! After he put us in a trash bag!
And called us “junk”!
I know it looks bad but, guys, ya gotta believe me!
Sure thing, “College Boy”!
Andy’s movin’ on, Woody! It’s time we did the same. Jessie and the others duck in the box, pull the flaps shu
Okay, out of the box! Everyone, right now! Come on! Buzz -- gimme a hand. We gotta get this thing outta here! He walks around and tries to push the box out of the car.

Woody -- wait! We need to figure out what’s best for every--... SLAM!!! The hatchback shuts. Buzz and Woody turn. Through the window, Andy’s Mom walks to the driver's seat, gets in. Woody and Buzz crouch down
Oh, great! Great!!! It’s gonna take us forever to get back here! The car lurches into gear and drives off.  28
The Toys have gathered around Barbie, who is sniffling. Mrs. Potato Head pats her shoulder.
It’s all right, Barbie. You'll be okay! Barbie nods, putting on a brave front.
Well... Molly and I have been growing apart for years, it’s just... I can’t believe she would throw me away! She breaks down again. Potato Head rolls his eyes.
Welcome to the club, Toots! Suddenly, the box flaps open and Woody and Buzz vault in.
Okay, everyone, listen up... We can get back to Andy’s but we gotta move fast. We’ll hide under the seats ‘til we get home... The Toys react, incensed.
Get it through your vinyl noggin, Woody -- Andy doesn’t want us anymore!
He was putting you... In the attic!!! Jessie goes toe-to-toe with Woody.
He left us... On the curb! Buzz intervenes.
Alright, calm down! Both of you!
Okay, fine! Just wait’ll you see what Day Care’s like!
Why...?! What’s it like?!  29
Day Care is a sad, lonely place for washed-up old toys who have no owners. Abruptly, Barbie bursts into tears.
Quite the charmer, aren't ya?
Oh, you'll see! As soon as we get to Day Care, you'll be begging to go home. The car hits a bump and Woody tumbles.
The car pulls into a modest day care center -- Sunnyside a cinder block building with bright, kid-friendly murals.
Andy’s Mom pulls out the box, carries it across the lot. Inside the box, the Toys peer out the hand slots.
Can anyone see anything?
There’s a playground...! Through fencing we SEE glimpses of kids running and playi with SHOUTS and LAUGHTER. The Toys look at each other.
We hit the jackpot, Bullseye!
So much for “sad and lonely”, eh?
Okay, calm down, guys. lLet’s keep this in perspective...
Perspective?! This place is perfect!
Woody, it’s nice! See, the door has a rainbow on it!  30
Andy’s Mom is BUZZED through glass doors. A RECEPTIONIST behind a counter types at a computer while a small girl o the counter plays with a toy chimp. Andy’s Mom enters.
Hey, there!
Wow! Haven’t seen you in ages...
Just wanted to drop these old toys off. She puts the box on the counter.
Is this Bonnie?! Look how big you are! The girl, BONNIE, looks up, then turns to her Mother, shy
Say hi, sweetie!
Hi.
How are your kids? Molly and Andy?
Not kids anymore. Andy’s going to college on Friday. Can you believe? The Receptionist opens the box. Bonnie tries to look in.
You sure they won’t miss these?
Nah, they never get played with. Mom departs and the Receptionist folds up the box flaps.
The Toys peek out as they are carried down a hallway.
You see any kids...?
Where’s she taking us?  31
The Box is placed on a counter. The Receptionist departs. In the box, the Toys step up and jostle for a view.
Look...!
Wow!

What?! What is it?!!! TOYS’ POV -- An idyllic day care classroom, filled with t happy bustle of four- and five-year-olds, playing with to -- dinosaurs, a baby doll, a pink Teddy bear, a Ken doll. The Toys stare, agog. Rex jockeys for a peek.
Aaah! I can’t see! A bell RINGS. A TEACHER opens the playground door.
Okay, everyone, recess! C’mon! The kids CHEER and flood out on the playground. The Teacher turns off lights, shuts the door behind her.
Silence. The room is still. The Toys speak sotto.
So, now what do we do?
We go back to Andy’s! Anyone see an exit?
Exit schmexit! Let’s get played with!
Careful! These toys might be jealous of new arrivals!
I wanna see! It’s my turn! Rex presses in. The Toys react.  32
Oooff...!!!
Whoa!
Hey! The whole box tilts and falls off the counter -- SPLAT!!! The Toys spill out. They look up. Around the room, all the Day Care Toys stare back. A Jack In The Box pops up.
New Toys! They all CHEER and burst into smiles. Jessie shakes hands with a ROCK MONSTER toy.
Well, howdy! Glad to meetcha! Buzz extends his hand to a ROBOT toy.
Buzz Lightyear, at your service. Hamm, Slinky and Barbie shake hands with an OCTOPUS toy.
Oh boy, oh boy, oh boy! Rex laughs, circled by adoring little dinosaurs. An Insect Man ACTION FIGURE helps Mrs. Potato Head get up

Oooh, thank you! (reaches for his bicep) Oh, may I? Ohhh! He flexes obligingly. She feels his arm, GIGGLES. Mr. Potato Head looks on. He flexes his own arm. It sags. A Crane toy circles the Aliens. They gaze up, rapturous.

The Claw...!!! SFX -- HONK! HONK! Everyone turns.  33 A Tonka Truck races forward, then backs up in a quick 180 arc, revealing a large pink Teddy bear, LOTSO, in its bed Lotso taps a Tinker Toy cane and the truck bed rises, “dumping” him out. Like Bob Hope stepping off the links i Palm Springs, Lotso exudes an easy, cheerful charisma.
Well, hello there! I thought I heard new voices! Welcome to Sunnyside, folks! I’m Lots-o’-Huggin’ Bear! But, please, call me Lotso! Buzz steps up, offers a hand.
Buzz Lightyear. We come in pea... Lotso grabs Buzz, lifts him in a smothering hug.
(chuckling) First thing you gotta know about me... I’m a hugger!! He releases Buzz, looks at the other Toys.
Oh, look at y’all! You been through a lot today, haven’t you?
Oh, it’s been horrible!

Well, you’re safe now. We’re all cast-offs here -- we been dumped, donated, yard-saled, second-handed, and just plain thrown out. But just you wait -- you'll find being donated was the best thing that ever happened to ya! Woody scoffs, but Rex steps up excitedly.
Mr. Lotso...? Do toys here get played with every day?
All day long. Five days a week.
But what happens when the kids grow up?  34 Lotso steps to a wall of day-care class photos.

Well, now, I’1ll tell ya -- when the kids get old, new ones come in. When they get old, new ones replace them. You’1l never be outgrown or neglected. Never abandoned or forgotten. No owners means no heartbreak. The Toys are overjoyed. Even Woody is taken by this visio
Yeee-hawww..!!!
It’s a miracle!
(to Woody) And you wanted us to stay at Andy’s!
Because we’re Andy’s toys! Lotso puts an arm around Woody.
So you got donated by this “Andy”, huh? Well, it’s his loss, Sheriff! He can’t hurt you no more.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa... Lotso cuts him off.
Now let’s get you all settled in. Ken?! Where is that boy? Ken...?! New toys! A Ken doll appears in an upper window of a doll house.

Far out! Hey, hi, everybody! (to Lotso) Down in a jiff, Lotso! He rides down in an elevator and opens the door. ON KEN -- Slip-on shoes, double-pleated shorts, and an unbuttoned animal-print shirt that reveals his ripped abs He addresses the Toys with an air of boundless self-regar  35
So. Who’s ready for Ken’s Dream Tour?
Let’s show our new friends where they’1l be stayin’!
Folks, if you wanna step right this-- He turns, sees Barbie. She looks up, sees him. Sparks fly. MUSIC swells. Destiny calls. They approach.
Hi! I’m Ken.
Barbie. (breathless) Have we ever me--...?
Huh-uh...! I would’ve remembered! (Barbie GIGGLES) Love your leg warmers.
Nice ascot. Lotso breaks the spell.
C'mon, Ken! Recess don’t last forever!
Right on, Lotso! This way everyone! He extends a gentlemanly arm. Barbie giggles, takes it.
You got a lot to look forward to, folks -- the Little Ones love new toys! He leads them off. Rex, Buzz, and Woody trail behind.
What a nice bear!
And he smells like strawberries! Woody sighs, exasperated.  36 As they walk, Ken addresses the Toys like a tour leader.
Folks, if I can share, here at Sunnyside, we've got, well, just about anything a Toy could ask for. Lotso leads them past shelves of toy supplies.
Spare parts, super glue, and enough fresh batteries to choke a Hungry- Hungry Hippo.
Lotso flings open a utility closet, revealing a spa-like workshop in which smaller Toys fix up bigger Toys -- stitching rips, etc. The Toys gasp, impressed.
Think you're gettin’ old? Well, stop your worryin’!
Our repair spa will keep you stuffed, puffed, and lightly buffed! An Elephant plushie is getting his belly re-stuffed. He SNEEZES. Stuffing flies everywhere.
As the tour continues, Ken gestures to his Dream House.
And this, well, this is where I live -- Ken’s Dream House. It has a disco, it’s got a dune buggy... And a whole room just for trying on clothes.
You have everything!!! Everything except someone to share it with. He looks down, walks off. Barbie sighs, about to faint. Lotso reaches a bathroom door at the end of the room.

You need anything at all, you just come talk to me. Here we are...!  37 Lotso raps the door with his cane. It’s opened by a large baby doll, BIG BABY, with a lazy, drooping eye. Big Baby COOS, peers out at the Toys. They stare up in wonder.
Well, thank you, Big Baby. Why don’t you come meet our new friends? He throws an arm around Big Baby in Toy-solidarity.
Poor Baby! We were thrown out together, me n’ him. Abandoned by the same owner!
Lotso leads the Toys through a bathroom.
But we don’t need owners here at Sunnyside! We own ourselves! We’re masters of our own fate...! We control our own destiny! Mr. Potato Head slips and falls, losing his parts.
Uh, watch out for puddles...
Lotso leads the Toys into a new classroom. The Day Care Toys here are scuffier and more toddler-appropriate.

And here’s where you folks’1l be staying -- the Caterpillar Room! The Toys gaze up in awe. There’s kid stuff everywhere: tiny tables and chairs, finger paintings, wood blocks, banners of the alphabet, wire cubby bins, etc. The whole beautiful, child-centric universe of day care.
Look at this place!
[Whistles]
Holy moly, guacamole!  38
Jackpot, baby!
Whoa, puppy!
Wow! A TOY TRAIN weaves through the room, blowing its WHISTLE. The Potato Heads look around in wonder.
(fighting tears) It’s so beautiful! Woody is awestruck. Something nudges him. A RINGING.
What the...? He looks down. An old Fisher Price Chatter Telephone is bumping into him. Woody kneels down, friendly. Woody (CONT'D) Oh, hey, little fella...
How long’s it been since y’all got played with?
It’s been years!
Well, just you wait. In a few minutes that bell’s gonna ring and you'll get the playtime you’ve been dreaming of.
Play! Real play!!! I can’t wait!!!
Now, if you’ll excuse us, we best be headin’ back. Welcome to Sunnyside, folks! Lotso climbs back into the Tonka Truck. The Toys wave.
Thank you!
Thank you there, Buddy Boy!  39
Take care, Pinky!
Goodbye, Mr. Lotso! Thank you!
Goodbye... ! Barbie turns to Ken -- an end-of-the-first-date moment.
Will I see you again?
Oh, I’1l see you tonight. In my dreams. She giggles. They stare. It’s like they could both spontaneously combust. At the bathroom door, Lotso waits.
Ken...! Let’s get a move on! Ken turns to Barbie, takes her hands.
Barbie, come with me! Live in my Dream House! I know it’s crazy! I know we've just met! Aw, heck -- you don’t know me from GI Joe. But when I look at you I feel like we were...
...-Made for each other! They gasp, thunderstruck. Barbie turns, gazes to the Toys Jessie grins and winks. Mrs. Potato Head waves -- Go!
Yay! She gives a leg kick. Ken pumps his fist.
Yessssssss... Lotso calls again.
Ken...!

Coming, Lotso!  40 Ken leads Barbie to the Truck and they hop in, giddy. Lotso taps his cane and the Truck roars off. Big Baby is the last to exit, closing the door -- CLICK -- behind the Through windows, children are heard LAUGHING and PLAYING. The Toys turn and wander toward the playground door.
Sounds like kids to me...!
Oh, I wanna get played with! Why can’t time go faster?!!!
How many ya reckon are out there?!
Oh, they sound so sweet! Woody looks at them, knowing he’s fighting a losing battl
Look, everyone, it’s nice here, I admit. But we need to go home...! The Toys glance at each other. Jessie steps forward.
We can have a whole new life here, Woody. A chance to make kids happy again.
Why don’t you stay?
Yeah, Woody! Stay with us!
Come on, Woodster!
You'll get played with...!
Stay here!
You can make a new kid happy!
I can’t! No, no! Guys, really, no! The Toys are taken aback. Woody struggles to stay calm.  41

I have a kid. You have a kid -- Andy! And if he wants us at college, or in the attic, well, then our job is to be there for him! Now I’m going home! Anyone wants to join me is welcome! C’mon, Buzz! He heads off. Buzz stays put. Woody turns back.
Buzz...? Buzz -- torn -- steps up to Woody, sober and gentle.
Our mission with Andy’s complete, Woody.
What...?!
And what's important now is we stay together.
We wouldn’t even be together if it weren’t for Andy! Look under your boot, Buzz! You too, Jessie! Whose name is written there? The Toys stare at the ground. Rex pipes up.
Maybe Andy doesn’t care about us any more?
Of course he does! He cares about all of you! He was putting you in the attic -- I saw! You can’t just turn your back on him now! Jessie steps forward -- incensed.
Woody -- wake up! It’s over! Andy is all grown up! Woody stares, trying to contain his anger.
Okay, fine! Perfect! I can’t believe how selfish you all are.  42 Jessie glares back. No one moves.

So this is it? After all we’ve been through? Buzz steps forward, offers a handshake. Woody looks at Buzz. He fixes his hat, turns away. Buzz is stung. Woody walks to the hall door. Bullseye follows. WOODY (CONT’D) Bullseye, no. You need to stay! He moves on. Bullseye again tries to follow.

Bullseye, no! I said stay! (softens) Look -- I don’t want you left alone in the attic, okay? Now, stay. Bullseye retreats. Jessie puts a consoling hand on him. KEYS in a LOCK. The Toys turn. BONNIE’S MOM (0.S.) Bonnie...? Bonnie! Woody looks at them, doesn’t know what else to say.

I gotta go. The Toys scatter. Woody hides behind the door just as Bonnie’s Mom enters. BONNIE’S MOM Bonnie? You in here? Woody sneaks out the door, into the hall. CLOSE ON -- Buzz and Jessie, watching.

TEACHERS CHAT at the end of the hallway. Woody peeks out from behind a garbage can, tip-toes into the hall, turns. A janitor cart approaches. Woody falls limp. The cart passes over Woody, leaving the hall empty. A whistling JANITOR pushes the cart down the hallway. TILT DOWN to FIND Woody holding the underside of the cart  43 WOODY POV -- He rolls through the lobby, toward the exit.
C’mon, c’mon... ...and veers into a bathroom.
No, no...!

The Janitor cleans the sinks. Woody sneaks into a nearby stall. Looks up, sees an open window. He tears a square of toilet paper, places it on the seat, climbs up the tank lid, leaps to the toilet paper roll, jumps to the top of the stall, backs toward the window. At the sink, the Janitor looks in the mirror, starts.

What the heck? Woody freezes. The Janitor stares at the mirror, Woody in its reflection. RACK FOCUS -- The Janitor reaches up, wipes a stain off. JANITOR (CONT’D) That’s better. RACK BACK -- The window in the mirror. Woody's gone.

Woody finds himself above the playground. Below, Bonnie plays hopscotch by herself. Her Mom walks over. BONNIE’S MOM Bonnie...? There you are. C’mon, honey. Time to go home. She leads Bonnie off. Woody climbs up a drainage pipe to the roof. He runs across the roof, stops at the edge. POV, PANNING -- A high wall surrounds the day care campus Woody frowns. A gust lifts his hat off, blows it away.
Oh, no! No, no, no...!  44 His hat lands under a kite tangled on the roof top. Woody stares at the kite -- an idea.

Woody runs across the roof, kite over his head. He leaps and soars across the playground and over the wall. He glides down, makes a perfect landing, and laughs, pleased Abruptly, another gust hits, yanking him high in the air. Woody looks at the ground far below. The wind takes the kite higher still, dipping and swirling frenetically. Woody panics, wrapping himself around the kite’s cross-ba The bar snaps. The kite plummets. Woody tries desperately to flap the kite wings, but it doesn’t slow his fall. He crashes into a tree, hitting branches on the way down. He falls from the tree and stops -- eyes shut -- inches above the pavement. Opens one eye. Slowly, his pull-string lifts him upward.

(voice box) Reach for the sky! Woody dangles from a branch, trying to free himself. Bonnie approaches, playing hopscotch. Woody sees her, goe limp. She bumps into Woody, looks up. Looks around. She tugs Woody off the branch. His pull-string retracts.
(voice box) You're my favorite deputy! She smiles. HONK HONK! BONNIE’S MOM (0.S.) Bonnie!
Coming! She shoves Woody in her backpack, zips it up, runs off.
Woody is trapped.
Oh, great!  45 As Bonnie and her Mom drive off, CRANE DOWN to REVEAL... Woody’s hat, lying on the ground.
Bullseye whimpers, stares at the door. Jessie consoles hi
Oh, it’s gonna be okay, Bullseye.
Woody's going to college with Andy. It’s what he’s always wanted.
He’s crazy! College is no place for a toy!
Toys are for play time!
Speaking of play time...! They’re lining up out there! Hamm, at the window, is spying on the playground.
How many?
There must be dozens!
Ohhh...! I can hardly wait!

Places, everyone! The Toys scramble into play position. Buzz notices the Day Care Toys edging away from the door ducking, hiding, trembling, diving for cover. The bell RINGS. Kids SHRIEK. Footsteps THUNDER. Rex spreads his arms and runs to the playground door.
At last! I’m gonna get played with!
Uh, Rex...?  46

Come to Papa! BOOM! The door bursts open, swatting Rex across the room. A horde of squealing, hyped-up TODDLERS enter. The Toys go limp. Buzz closes his helmet. The toddlers descend on the Toys with SHRIEKS of delight. Toys are snatched up by eager, excited hands. A Boy and Girl stretch Slinky until his coil goes haywire A Boy smashes the Toy Train into a wall. A Girl picks up Buzz, bringing him straight to her mouth. A Girl dips Jessie’s hair in paint and uses her as a brus A Boy runs across the room, with Bullseye on top of a Cor Popper toy. Bullseye slides off, gets caught in its wheel Hamm is bathed in glue... Then coated in green glitter. A Girl “rides” Rex, snapping his tail off. The Aliens are squashed as a Boy sits on them. A Boy picks up Mr. Potato Head’s eye, shoves it up his no A Girl uses Buzz to hammer a square peg into a round hole BUZZ POV -- Buzz smashes the peg. Bam, Bam, Bam! A Boy runs by, tugs the Girl’s hair. She screams, tosses Buzz away. He lands on the window sill. BUZZ POV -- Across the playgound, in the Butterfly Room, class of Four- and Five-Year-Olds play lovingly with Lots and the other toys. Buzz frowns -- Why is it Heaven in there and Hell in here Abruptly, a HAND grabs him, pulls him back into the fray.
(voicebox) There’s a snake in my boot!  47
CLOSE ON -- Woody. His string is pulled again.
(voicebox) I'd like to join your posse, boys, but first I’m gonna sing a little song. Bonnie holds Woody, smiles.
A sheriff..!! Move over, Mr. Pricklepants! We have a guest! She plunks Woody at a small table circled by other toys - a HEDGEHOG, a UNICORN, and a TRICERATOPS.
You want some coffee? She sets out cups, pretends to pour.
It’s good for you! But don’t drink too much or you'll hafta... Hafta... She dances from foot to foot.
Be right back...! She runs out the door. Woody comes alive, looks around. The other Toys stay frozen.
Psst! Hey! Hello! Hi -- Excuse me! The Hedgehog, MR. PRICKLEPANTS, comes alive briefly.
Shhh!
Can you tell me where I am?
Shhhhhh!!!
The guy’s just askin’ a question!  48
Well, excuse me, I’m trying to stay in character! He freezes again. The Unicorn, friendly, turns to Woody.
My name’s Buttercup.
Shhhh!!!!
I’m Trixie!
Shhhhh!!!!
Shhhhhh!!!!!
Shhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!
Guys, hey! I don’t know where I am!
We’re either in a cafe in Paris, or a coffee shop in New Jersey. I’m pretty sure I just came back from the doctor with life-changing news! Woody is baffled.
We do a lot of improv here. Just stay loose, have fun, you'll be fine.
No, no, no, I... A FLUSH. Woody gets back in his pose. Bonnie runs in.
Who wants lunch? Beep! Boop! Beep! She pushes buttons on a toy microwave oven, opens the doo removes a plastic hamburger, plunks it in front of Woody.
It has a secret ingredient... She lifts the top bun...  49
...Jellybeans! Bonnie eats a jellybean, pulls Woody’s string.
(voicebox) Somebody's poisoned the water hole!
Poison?! She spits the jellybean -- it sticks to Pricklepants’s he
Who would do such a mean thing?! She GASPS and becomes a different character.
(as Witch) Hee-hee-hee-hee-hee! ! She turns. SMASH ZOOM to a DOLL on the shelf behind her.
The scary witch!! Bonnie picks up the Doll, flies it around the room.
Look out! She’s using her witch powers! CLOSE ON -- Woody.
I know where to hide! INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER The toy box at the foot of Bonnie’s bed. It creaks open. Bonnie peeks out, grabs a Totoro, pulls it closed again.
Bonnie and Woody huddle in the dark.
She’1l never find us in here! Bonnie surreptitiously lifts the Doll into view.  50
What’s wrong...? She turns. Sees the doll, SCREAMS. INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM - DAY The toy box tips over, spilling Bonnie and her Toys.
She found us! We need a spaceship to get away! She runs off into a closet. The Toys come alive.
You're doin’ great!
Are you classically trained?
Look, I just need to know how to get outta here...!
There IS NO WAY OUT!!! Woody is stunned.
Just kidding. Door’s right over there. The Doll gets up, greets Woody.
Well, Cowboy, you just jumped right in, didn't ya? I’m Dolly.
..-Uh, Woody. They shake.
“Woody”? Really? You’re gonna stick with that? ‘Cuz now’s your chance to change it -- new room and all. That's coming from a doll named “Dolly”. A PEA POD TOY zips open behind Woody. He turns.  51
Who’s the new guy?
Are you a real cowboy?
Well, actually, I....
‘Course he’s not, pea-brain! He don’t even have a hat!
I do too have a... My hat?!
Told ‘ya!
I found the spaceship!!
Show time! Woody and the Toys go lifeless as Bonnie runs out of the closet with makeshift shoebox rocket.
Quick! Fasten your seatbelts! Close your tray tables! She stuffs the toys in the box, drops it on a bedsheet. BONNIE (CONT’D) Hold on, it might get a little bumpy!
She pulls the sheet taut. The Toys fly into the air. SLOW MOTION -- Woody soaring. The moment is magical. Woody and the others tumble onto the bed. Bonnie flops down with them, hugging them close.

Yeee-haaaaw!!! You saved us, cowboy! You're our hero!!! She pulls Woody to her cheek -- just like Andy once did. Woody glances at the other Toys. They smile at him. He smiles back. That was great.  52
The Toys come to life, groaning.
Oh, I’ve got a kink in my slink. Rex staggers by, tail missing.
My tail...! Where’s my tail?! Buzz sits up, dazed. Hamm pulls his cork. Detritus spills out. He strains. POP -- a Weeble pops out. Hamm picks up a plastic arm.
Someone need a hand? He tosses it to Mr. and Mrs. Potato Head -- their parts completely jumbled.

head_text.subj: MR. POTATO HEAD MRS. POTATO HEAD

text: Where’s my nose... Here’s Here it is... Gimme that, your arm... Honey, the that’s mine... moustache...?
Buzz straightens up -- back CRACKING.
I don’t recall play time being quite that strenuous. Rex pulls his tail from a peg board.
Andy never played with us like that! Jessie peels a decal off Bullseye’s nose.
We have to make the best of it.
But these toddlers! They don’t know how to play with us!
They’re too young!
They're sticky!  53
We should be in the Butterfly Room! With the big kids!
That’s right! You said it!
We'll get this straightened out -- I‘1l go talk to Lotso about moving us to the other room. He clambers up a table, leaps to the bathroom door knob. It doesn’t move.
Blast. Try that one! Jessie leaps to the hallway door latch.
It’s locked! At the playground door, Slinky tests the door knob.
Same here! Buzz drops down, points.
Try the windows. Hamm, on the sill, examines a window lock.
Eh, negatory. It’s a Fenster- Schneckler 380. Finest childproof lock in the world.
We're trapped!
Wait! Did anyone notice the transom?
What’s a transom, Buzz? Buzz looks up -- atop the hallway door is an open transom
Oh, great! How do we get up there?! Buzz narrows his eyes, thinking.  54
The Toys hold a Fisher Price Corn Popper. Buzz, a loop of red yarn wrapped across his chest, stands at the rear.
All right, everyone! On three! One... Two...
Three!!! They take off, pushing the popper at top speed.

Let go! The Toys drop away, leaving Buzz to jump onto the handle. The popper strikes an upturned table, lofting Buzz in the air. He grabs a string that runs across the room, using i like a zip-line. As he reaches the end, Buzz leaps off, expands his wings and flies towards a display of hanging paper-mache caterpillars, using their legs to swing from one to another. On the ground, Hamm makes signal.
Jump! Bullseye and Rex jump off a shelf, catapulting a broom forward. Buzz bounces off the broom, towards the transom. He flips, twists, and lands -- safe. The Toys rejoice.
He did it!!!

Way to go, Buzz! Buzz casts part of his yarn down to the Toys. They run an grab it. Buzz turns to the hallway, stops. BUZZ POV -- In the hall below, a pair of tough Day Care Toys, TWITCH (Bug Man) and CHUNK (Rock Man) saunter past.
You think they had a fun playtime?
Shhh...!!! They might hear you! Buzz frowns. O.S. GIGGLING. Buzz turns. Down the hall, Ken and Barbie say goodbye at the Butterfly Room door.
Okay, now you start.
..-love...
-.-you.
See?! That time I said “love”. Okay, now, me first. Buzz. He stifles a dry heave.
Okay, okay, okay....!
..-love...
»..-you! See what I mean? It changes every time!
You are so smart! As the Tough Toys pass, they drag Ken away.
C’mon, Romeo... We’re late.
I‘1l wait up for you!
Kisses...!

Buzz -- using the red yarn -- rappels down into the hall. He unties the yarn and steals off down the hallway. He reaches the Teacher's Lounge, approaches cautiously.  56 INT. TEACHERS’ LOUNGE - NIGHT Buzz peeks in. Ken, Twitch and Chunk approach a vending machine. Ken opens the bottom flap and they all go inside Buzz frowns. He walks to the vending machine. Suddenly -- strangely -- a cow MOOOOS. Buzz looks around, confused. Then he looks up. Silhouetted in the top of a glowing vending machine are K and the rest of his Gang. A Rooster crows: COCKADOODLE- DOO!! This is followed by MUFFLED LAUGHS and HUBBUB. Buzz approaches the machine. From inside come VOICES. GANG (0.S. Yeah, all right! Let’s go again! Buzz pushes open the dispenser flap, climbs in. Above him a pig OINKS loudly. More LAUGHS and GRIPES.
Buzz climbs up rows of candy bars and potato chips. He gets to the top, sneaks towards the light. In the top of the vending machine, a Gang of toys sits around a table.

All right, place yer bets! Any splits? Here we go! The Gang throws batteries, Monopoly money, other items in a pot. Stretch the Octopus pulls the cord on a Farmer Say toy. As the arrow spins, the Gang roots for their bets.
C’mon, Duckie, Duckie! Big Pig! Big Pig...! Turkey! Gimme the Turkey!! Ken waves his hand over the table.
All right. No more bets. The spinning arrow stops on “Duck”.
Here is a duck: “Quack, quack”.
Yes! Yes! Come to Mama! Stretch scoops up the pile of money. The others GROAN.  57
Stretch takes the round. The game continues, Ken presiding.
Okay, minimum bet, five Monopoly. Coyotes wild. Changing two double AA's. (as he changes money: ) Hey, what do you guys think of the new recruits? Any Keepers?
Nah, disposable...!
Landfill!
Cowgirl...? Dinosaur...?
Toddler fodder! They start placing bets again.
How ‘bout that Spaceguy? He could be useful. Buzz reacts, listening.
He ain’t the sharpest knife in the... place where they keep the knives.
Neither are you, Chunk. LAUGHS. Twitch teases Ken.
You got a little Keeper yourself, didn’t’cha, Ken?
Hey! Lay off, Twitch! Barbie's different!
Mr. Softy over here...!
Whaddaya expect from a girls toy?  58 Ken stands, furious.
I’m not a girls toy! I’m not! Why do you guys keep saying that?!!! Twitch waves a hand.

All them Toys are disposable. We'll be lucky if they last us a week! Buzz reacts. He turns to go... And bumps into Big Baby. Big Baby tosses Buzz on the table. The Gang quickly grabs and subdues him. Ken smirks.
Well, well, looky who we have here.
Stop! Let me go! He struggles. Ken narrows his eyes.
Take him to “The Library”.
Nooooooo! A sock puppet is pulled over Buzz’s head.

INT. BONNIE’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Bonnie sleeps -- toys tucked next to her. Woody carefully slips from under the covers. Bonnie stirs, moves her arm. Woody freezes, leg in the air. She settles back to sleep. Woody tiptoes across the bed, looks around the room. ZOOM IN -- Bonnie’s backpack, hanging from her door handl Woody pushes a chair to the door, climbs up, lifts a cape The address on the backpack is revealed -- 1225 Sycamore.
1225 Sycamore!
Woody...! What’re you doing?  59 Woody turns. Bonnie’s Toys are watching from the bed.
I... I gotta get out of here!
You're leaving?!
Didn’t you have fun today?
Of course I did! More ‘n I’ve had in years, but... Y’see, I belong to someone else... He holds up his boot, where “ANDY” is written.
Who's “Yid-nah”?
I believe it’s pronounced “Yid-nay”.
Guys -- it says “Andy”!
He’s my Bonnie...! And he’s leaving soon. I gotta get home!
Where’s home?
Elm Street. 234 Elm. (thinking) You guys have a map?
